question: Which of the following is the characteristic of people with type B personality?
In the 5 factor model of personality, conscientiousness represents which type of character?
In general adaptation syndrome, resistance to stress is decreased in which state?
Which of the following approaches should not be used for stress management?
Traits are defined as which of the following?

answers.option: Brain regions that differ in different people
Physical characteristics that distinguish us from other people
Permanent personality characteristics that distinguish us from other people
Relatively enduring characteristics that influence our behavior across many situations
Unconscious tendencies to act in different ways according to the situation

question: A girl is friendly, always willing to help others, and compassionate. We should expect her to score highly on which of the following?
A doctor asks the patient to tense a group of muscles and then relax them. What is this technique called?

A 35-year-old young male working in a marketing company was referred to you by a cardiologist after a minor angina attack. He complained of decreased sleep and pain in neck muscles. He works almost 10 to 12 hours a day and rides motorbikes to meet his clients in the city. He gained weight of 15 Kg in the last two months, having a body mass index of 35 Kg/m^2. What could be the possible reason for his recent attack?

answers.option: Stress induced increase in IL-6 and CRP

question: Erikson postulated that every stage is basically a defined period of age in which a particular conflict arises. The way these conflicts are dealt with will determine the end result which can be either a successful resolution or a continuation of the conflict. If the conflict is resolved, the stage is satisfied, an inner attribute will be acquired. What is this inner attribute?
A man is very self-conscious about hygiene so he is always washing his hands and wearing gloves. Which psychosexual stage of development did he potentially skip?

A 5-year-old boy was brought by his mother with complaints of excessive biting and excessively placing objects in his mouth. Which of the following statements describes the reason for this behavior according to Sigmund Freud's psychosexual development theory?

answers.option: Oral cavity is a site of pleasure

question: A 30-year-old man visits the clinic and presents with the complaint of regular hand washing for 2 months. He says that he always wears gloves and keeps washing his hands because he has a fear of contamination. In which of the following stages of psychosexual development has the man experienced problems?

While studying, a student is also observing if he is solving the question correctly, and when he faces a problem while solving a question, he uses strategies to solve his problem. Which of his actions defines metacognition?

answers.option: He understands the concepts taught in class
He memorizes the formulas before solving the questions
Using strategies to solve his problem and analyzing how is he doing while solving
He completes the assigned homework using his cognition and thinking
He sees at the end whether he has done right or wrong
